summary:
The Venus de Milo is a famous ancient Greek statue of the goddess Aphrodite. It was found in Greece in 1820 and is now in the Louvre Museum. The sculpture is over 2 meters tall and made of high-quality marble. It's missing its arms, and experts aren't sure how they were originally positioned.

This masterpiece became very popular after it was discovered, inspiring artists and writers. However, some scholars think it's not as important as other ancient sculptures mentioned in old texts, even though those sculptures only survive as lesser-quality copies.
title: Venus de Milo
